00333 // Transparent Union of object types.
00335 
00336 #ifndef TRANSPARENT_UNION
00337     #define TRANSPARENT_UNION __attribute__((transparent_union))
00338 #endif
00339 typedef union {
00340     optApplicationP      Application;
00341     optBridgeP           Bridge;
00342     optBusP              Bus;
00343     optBusCallbackP      BusCallback;
00344     optBusPortP          BusPort;
00345     optBusPortConnP      BusPortConn;
00346     optCommandP          Command;
00347     optExtensionP        Extension;
00348     optExtElabP          ExtElab;
00349     optFIFOP             FIFO;
00350     optFIFOPortP         FIFOPort;
00351     optFIFOPortConnP     FIFOPortConn;
00352     optFormalP           Formal;
00353     optFormalEnumP       FormalEnum;
00354     optMemoryP           Memory;
00355     optMMCP              MMC;
00356     optMMRegisterP       MMRegister;
00357     optModuleP           Module;
00358     optNetP              Net;
00359     optNetCallbackP      NetCallback;
00360     optNetPortP          NetPort;
00361     optNetPortConnP      NetPortConn;
00362     optPacketnetP        Packetnet;
00363     optPacketnetCallbackP PacketnetCallback;
00364     optPacketnetPortP    PacketnetPort;
00365     optPacketnetPortConnP PacketnetPortConn;
00366     optParamP            Param;
00367     optPeripheralP       Peripheral;
00368     optProcessorP        Processor;
00369     optProcRootP         ProcRoot;
00370 } optObjectP TRANSPARENT_UNION;

00377 typedef enum optStrTypeE {
00378     OPT_NIL_EN            = 0x0,
00379     OPT_APPLICATION_EN    = 0x1,
00380     OPT_BRIDGE_EN         = 0x2,
00381     OPT_BUS_EN            = 0x4,
00382     OPT_BUSCALLBACK_EN    = 0x8,
00383     OPT_BUSPORT_EN        = 0x10,
00384     OPT_BUSPORTCONN_EN    = 0x20,
00385     OPT_COMMAND_EN        = 0x40,
00386     OPT_EXTENSION_EN      = 0x80,
00387     OPT_EXTELAB_EN        = 0x100,
00388     OPT_FIFO_EN           = 0x200,
00389     OPT_FIFOPORT_EN       = 0x400,
00390     OPT_FIFOPORTCONN_EN   = 0x800,
00391     OPT_FORMAL_EN         = 0x1000,
00392     OPT_FORMALENUM_EN     = 0x2000,
00393     OPT_MEMORY_EN         = 0x4000,
00394     OPT_MMC_EN            = 0x8000,
00395     OPT_MMREGISTER_EN     = 0x10000,
00396     OPT_MODULE_EN         = 0x20000,
00397     OPT_NET_EN            = 0x40000,
00398     OPT_NETCALLBACK_EN    = 0x80000,
00399     OPT_NETPORT_EN        = 0x100000,
00400     OPT_NETPORTCONN_EN    = 0x200000,
00401     OPT_PACKETNET_EN      = 0x400000,
00402     OPT_PACKETNETCALLBACK_EN  = 0x800000,
00403     OPT_PACKETNETPORT_EN  = 0x1000000,
00404     OPT_PACKETNETPORTCONN_EN  = 0x2000000,
00405     OPT_PARAM_EN          = 0x4000000,
00406     OPT_PERIPHERAL_EN     = 0x8000000,
00407     OPT_PROCESSOR_EN      = 0x10000000,
00408     OPT_PROCROOT_EN       = 0x20000000,
00409 } optStrType;

00451 // Callbacks.
00453 
00454 // This function is called before elaboration begins.             Use this call-back to create formal parameters for the module.             Parameters to the formals can change the module's structure.
00455 
00456 #define OPT_INTERFACE_FN(_name) \
00457 void _name ( \
00458     optModuleP       mi, \
00459     optModuleObjectP object)
00460 
00461 typedef OPT_INTERFACE_FN((*optInterfaceFn));
00462 
00463 // This function is called during elaboration.              Use this call-back to create structure including model and sub-module instances, interconnect, external ports, permanent (static) bridges and callbacks This call-back will call the elaboration function of each sub-module, in definition order, depth first. This function is called before elaboration begins. Use this call-back to create formal parameters for the module. Parameters to the formals can change the module's structure.
00464 
00465 #define OPT_CONSTRUCT_FN(_name) \
00466 void _name ( \
00467     optModuleP       mi, \
00468     optModuleObjectP object)
00469 
00470 typedef OPT_CONSTRUCT_FN((*optConstructFn));
00471 
00472 // This function is called after the elaboration of this and all other              modules when all structure is guaranteed to exist. Use this call-back to interrogate other modules
00473 
00474 #define OPT_POST_CONSTRUCT_FN(_name) \
00475 void _name ( \
00476     optModuleP       mi, \
00477     optModuleObjectP object)
00478 
00479 typedef OPT_POST_CONSTRUCT_FN((*optPostConstructFn));
00480 
00481 // This function is called immediately before simulation is about to begin for the first time only.              Use this module top set up delayed callbacks
00482 
00483 #define OPT_PRE_SIMULATE_FN(_name) \
00484 void _name ( \
00485     optModuleP       mi, \
00486     optModuleObjectP object)
00487 
00488 typedef OPT_PRE_SIMULATE_FN((*optPreSimulateFn));
00489 
00490 // This function is called each time the top-level simulation is started after pre-simulation or at restart after a stop-event.
00491 
00492 #define OPT_SIMULATE_FN(_name) \
00493 void _name ( \
00494     optModuleP       mi, \
00495     optModuleObjectP object)
00496 
00497 typedef OPT_SIMULATE_FN((*optSimulateFn));
00498 
00499 // This function is called only once, when simulation has finished, before any destruction. Use this call-back to gather and report simulation statistics.
00500 
00501 #define OPT_POST_SIMULATE_FN(_name) \
00502 void _name ( \
00503     optModuleP       mi, \
00504     optModuleObjectP object)
00505 
00506 typedef OPT_POST_SIMULATE_FN((*optPostSimulateFn));
00507 
00508 // This function is called during platform destruction. Use this call-back to free resources unknown to the simulator. It should not rely on existence of other modules.
00509 
00510 #define OPT_DESTRUCT_FN(_name) \
00511 void _name ( \
00512     optModuleP       mi, \
00513     optModuleObjectP object)
00514 
00515 typedef OPT_DESTRUCT_FN((*optDestructFn));
00516 
00517 // (Incomplete feature) This function is called when system save is invoked. Use this call-back to save module data unknown to the simulator
00518 
00519 #define OPT_MODULE_SAVE_FN(_name) \
00520 void _name ( \
00521     optModuleP       mi, \
00522     optModuleObjectP object)
00523 
00524 typedef OPT_MODULE_SAVE_FN((*optModuleSaveFn));
00525 
00526 // (Incomplete feature) This function is called when system restore is invoked. Use this call-back to restore module data unknown to the simulator
00527 
00528 #define OPT_MODULE_RESTORE_FN(_name) \
00529 void _name ( \
00530     optModuleP       mi, \
00531     optModuleObjectP object)
00532 
00533 typedef OPT_MODULE_RESTORE_FN((*optModuleRestoreFn));
00534 
00535 // Callback used when a processor accesses
00536 
00537 #define OPT_MEM_WATCH_FN(_name) \
00538 void _name ( \
00539     optProcessorP processor, \
00540     Addr          addr, \
00541     Uns32         bytes, \
00542     const void*   data, \
00543     void*         userData, \
00544     Addr          VA)
00545 
00546 typedef OPT_MEM_WATCH_FN((*optMemWatchFn));
00547 
00548 // Callback for a command definition
00549 
00550 #define OPT_COMMAND_FN(_name) \
00551 void _name ( \
00552     optCommandP command, \
00553     void*       userData)
00554 
00555 typedef OPT_COMMAND_FN((*optCommandFn));

00642 // Notifier function for register changes
00643

00645 Bool _name ( \

00647     void*         userData)

00649 typedef OPT_REG_NOTIFY_FN((*optRegNotifyFn));
00650 
00651 // Memory watchpoint notification callback
00652 
00653 #define OPT_MEM_NOTIFY_FN(_name) \
00654 Bool _name ( \
00655     optWatchpointP watchpoint, \
00656     optProcessorP  processor, \
00657     Addr           PA, \
00658     Addr           VA, \
00659     Uns32          bytes, \
00660     void*          userData, \
00661     void*          value)
00662 
00663 typedef OPT_MEM_NOTIFY_FN((*optMemNotifyFn));
00664 
00665 // Command parser error handler function
00666 
00667 #define OPT_CMD_ERROR_HANDLER_FN(_name) \
00668 void _name ( \
00669     const char * flag, \
00670     void*        userData)
00671 
00672 typedef OPT_CMD_ERROR_HANDLER_FN((*optCmdErrorHandlerFn));
00673

00675 
00676 #define OPT_PROCESSOR_ITERATOR_FN(_name) \

00678     optProcessorP processor, \
00679     void*         userData)
00680 
00681 typedef OPT_PROCESSOR_ITERATOR_FN((*optProcessorIteratorFn));
00682

00697     void*         data, \
00698     void*         userData, \

00700     Bool          isFetch)
00701

00885 
00886 
00888 // Public structures.
00890 
00891 // Definition of a module bus port
00892 
00893 typedef struct optBusPortInfoS {
00894     const char *             name; // Bus port name
00895     const char *             description; // Bus port description
00896     Bool                     mustConnect; // True if this port must be connected
00897 } optBusPortInfo;
00898 
00899 // Definition of a module FIFO port
00900 
00901 typedef struct optFIFOPortInfoS {
00902     const char *             name; // FIFO port name
00903     const char *             description; // FIFO port description
00904     optBusPortType           type; // input or output
00905     Bool                     mustConnect; // True if this port must be connected
00906     Uns32                    width; // Number of bits in a FIFO word
00907 } optFIFOPortInfo;
00908 
00909 // Definition of a module net port
00910 
00911 typedef struct optNetPortInfoS {
00912     const char *             name; // Net port name
00913     const char *             description; // Net port description
00914     optNetPortType           type; // input, output or inout
00915     Bool                     mustConnect; // True if this port must be connected
00916 } optNetPortInfo;
00917 
00918 // Definition of a module formal parameter enumerated value
00919 
00920 typedef struct optEnumParamSpecS {
00921     const char *             name; // Net port name
00922     const char *             description; // Net port description
00923     Uns32                    value; // Value
00924 } optEnumParamSpec;
00925 
00926 // Definition of a module formal parameter
00927 
00928 typedef struct optParamSpecS {
00929     const char *             name; // Formal parameter name
00930     const char *             description; // Formal parameter  description
00931     optParamType             type; // Formal parameter  type
00932     union {
00933         struct {
00934             Bool                     defaultValue; 
00935         } boolSpec;
00936 
00937         struct {
00938             double                   defaultValue; 
00939             double                   min; 
00940             double                   max; 
00941         } doubleSpec;
00942 
00943         struct {
00944             optEnumParamSpecP        legalValues; 
00945         } enumSpec;
00946 
00947         struct {
00948             Int32                    defaultValue; 
00949             Int32                    min; 
00950             Int32                    max; 
00951         } int32Spec;
00952 
00953         struct {
00954             Uns32                    defaultValue; 
00955             Uns32                    min; 
00956             Uns32                    max; 
00957         } uns32Spec;
00958 
00959         struct {
00960             Uns64                    defaultValue; 
00961             Uns64                    min; 
00962             Uns64                    max; 
00963         } uns64Spec;
00964 
00965         struct {
00966             const char *             defaultValue; 
00967             Uns32                    maxLength; 
00968         } stringSpec;
00969 
00970     } spec;
00971 
00972 } optParamSpec;
00973 
00974 // Definition of a module packetnet port
00975 
00976 typedef struct optPacketnetPortInfoS {
00977     const char *             name; // Packetnet port name
00978     const char *             description; // Packetnet port description
00979     optNetPortType           type; // input, output or inout
00980     Bool                     mustConnect; // True if this port must be connected
00981     Uns32                    bytes; // Maximum number of bytes in a packet
00982 } optPacketnetPortInfo;
00983 
00984 // Module connections
00985 
00986 typedef struct optConnectionsS {
00987     optBusPortConnP          busPortConns; // List of bus ports
00988     optNetPortConnP          netPortConns; // List of net ports
00989     optPacketnetPortConnP    packetnetPortConns; // List of packetnet ports
00990     optFIFOPortConnP         fifoPortConns; // List of FIFO ports
00991 } optConnections;
00992 
00993 // Callbacks to a debugger
00994 
00995 typedef struct optDebuggerNotifiersS {
00996     optSimulateStartFn       start; // Callback at start of simulation
00997     optSimulateStartFn       endPeripheralCons; // Callback before PSE constructors have run
00998     optSimulateStartFn       endPlatformCons; // Callback after platform constructor has run
00999     optSimulateStartFn       endCons; // Callback after all constructors have run
01000     optSimulatePostProcessorFn postProcessor; // Callback after processor execution
01001     optSimulatePostPeriphFn  postPeripheral; // Callback after peripheral execution
01002     optSimulateTimeAdvanceFn advance; // Callback when time advances
01003     optSimulateEndFn         end; // Callback at end of simulation
01004     void*                    userData; // User data
01005 } optDebuggerNotifiers;
01006 
01007 // Object file information
01008 
01009 typedef struct optObjectInfoS {
01010     Addr                     entry; // Program entry point
01011     Addr                     loadAddress; // Program load address
01012     Addr                     headerOffset; // Offset of program header
01013     Uns32                    headerEntry; // Program header entry
01014     Uns32                    headerNumber; // Number of program headers
01015     const char*              interpreter; // Path to required interpreter if required. String is not persistent
01016     Uns16                    cpuType; // Processor architecture ELF code, COFF code, etc.
01017     Uns16                    cpuSupp; // Processor supplementary type (not usd yet).
01018     optEndian                endian; // Enumerated type; processor endian.
01019 } optObjectInfo;
01020 
01021 // 'modelattrs' structure defined in each module
01022 
01023 typedef struct optModuleAttrS {
01024     const char*              versionString; // Version string. Must be OP_VERSION
01025     optModelType             type; // MUST be set to OPT_MODULE
01026     const char*              name; // A default name
01027     Uns32                    objectSize; // Bytes to allocate for each instance
01028     optVisibility            visibility; // Model instance is invisible
01029     optReleaseStatus         releaseStatus; // Model release status (enum)
01030     optPurpose               purpose; // Model purpose
01031     optConstructFn           constructCB; // see definition above
01032     optPostConstructFn       postConstructCB; // see definition above
01033     optPreSimulateFn         preSimulateCB; // see definition above
01034     optSimulateFn            simulateCB; // see definition above
01035     optPostSimulateFn        postSimulateCB; // see definition above
01036     optDestructFn            destructCB; // see definition above
01037     optSaveFn                saveCB; // see definition above
01038     optRestoreFn             restoreCB; // see definition above
01039     optBusPortFn             busPortSpecsCB; // call for each bus port
01040     optFIFOPortFn            FIFOPortSpecsCB; // call for each FIFO port
01041     optNetPortFn             netPortSpecsCB; // call for each net port
01042     optPacketnetPortFn       packetnetPortSpecsCB; // call for each packetnet port
01043     optParamSpecFn           paramSpecsCB; // call for each parameter
01044 } optModuleAttr;
01045 
01046 
01047 #endif /* OPTTYPES_H */
